Now consider this. It´s just a still image, with only one side visible and doesn´t take into consideration her abilities, other angles and motion in general.

Turning Frostblade Irelia into Championship Irelia isn´t the way to go about it. The blades could have more modelling and texturing work done to them, but as far as the skin itself is concerned in terms of accuracy to theme and clarity, it´s fine. Plus, there´s a little but very important thing called colorblind mode. If making it more like the old Frostblade worsens the clarity for colorblind people, then Riot isn´t gonna go ahead and change it.

Besides, Riot said they wanted to double down on the frost theme and abandon the cyber part of it and it´s honestly okay that they do so. If Aether Wing Kayle changed color palette and overall theme to be something similar to the angels in Darksiders, with black undersuits and silver armor with gold accents and glowing wings, i wouldn´t mind it.

If Riot wants to go the extra mile with FB Irelia, make the blades more like jagged icicles, contrast blue tones more and give shimmering effects on ice textures. That´s it. A lot of people didn´t like how shittier Tyrant Swain became, but it didn´t result in such a fuss because it still kept the general theme of it.

Frostblade Newrelia is the same case. It´s still Frostblade. Maybe not the one we knew, but it is the one we´ll likely get. And i´m fine with it. I liked the fur scarf, and i´d argue that it could´ve been made thinner instead of completely removed, but the fur on her arms is neat too.

Please learn how colour blindness works. The most common kind of CB has nothing to do with blue and yellow, it just makes it hard to differentiate red and green. Even the rarer blue/yellow kind wouldn't make the skin hard to see, it would just make it look blue/pink rather than blue/gold.

neither red/green or blue/yellow colourblindness affect one's ability to see blue. The skin is bulk blue. Even if it wasn't there's inking. There's really no way it would be hard for anyone to see. Also the addition of extra colours never makes colourblindness worse. It's the lack of contrast between either red and green in the common case or red and yellow in the rare case that makes it hard to see. Basically the common complaint is that something green or red becomes hard to see, not blue. 

Just to prove a point here's the image in two colourblindness simulators. Sorry about the cropping, the thing was a pain but you can see enough of the images to see there's really no issues.

R/G (common)

https://imgur.com/a/OP9jn

B/Y (rare)

https://imgur.com/a/VLkbS

Neither skin is going to cause huge issues, because neither is prominently yellow or red, which are the worst colours for y/b and r/g colourblindness respectively. The added yellow can really only help TBH. It's just extra contrast. If the blue is for some reason an issue for someone (I've never heard of this) then it's logical to assume the yellow trims on the edit would make it clearer for that person while the Riot skin doesn't have anything to help with this other than her face maybe.

I know that I’m probably about to step into a furnace here, so let me preface this by saying this is only my opinion.

While I definitely *like* the presented modified versions of the skin, I do *not* feel that they represent an adequate alternative to the current tweaks to the skins on the PBE, and I will explain why.

To begin, as I think was mentioned in a separate thread on the same topic, the modified skin is *way* too ostentatious, even in comparison with the current iteration of the skin. The excessive number of flairs and wings on the skin are more reminiscent of a Demacian warrior and less of an Frostborne blade dancer.

Also, it’s important to keep in mind that while the chatacter’s base lore changing to now specifically fighting with her pisonic blades and what technically constitutes “dance”, it’s not unreasonable to assume that certain flairs on certain skins might change also. I happen to really enjoy the old Frostblade Irelia, but their character archetypes are different. Old Irelia was just a warrior that swung her swords with her mind, and nothing more. New Irelia’s personal story is all the more richer, and new skins should somewhat reflect that.

My last main point to bring out is connected with the first. Frostblade Irelia had a definite high-tech feel to it with the lights on her combat suit. This skin doesn’t really bring any of that into the equation. It is also entirely possible (conjecture here) that Riot may have intended for this skin to more closely reflect the original but felt that Infiltrator and Nightblade(?) too closely overlapped that “high-tech” skin concept.

A slight sidepoint is that the blades took up a lot of design capital in the old skin, while Irelia’s suit itself was fairly simple. The new design doesn’t have that, which means that more capital has to be spent on the suit itself, which may have caused all of this to begin with.

Make of it what you will. Not trying to trash anyone, just putting my thought out there.
